revised_title: Diurnal Barometric Maxima and Their Relation to Temperature, Cloud, and Rainfall
tldr: The author examines the relationship between diurnal barometric maxima and critical conditions of temperature, cloud, and rainfall. They find that the morning maximum of pressure generally coincides with the instant of most rapid temperature increase, while the evening maximum often coincides with a minimum in the diurnal variation of cloud and rainfall. These findings suggest that atmospheric compression and dynamic heating of cloud-forming strata may play a role in these phenomena.
